about.title: About Kristian
about.lead: Second-year informatics student at NTNU building software that actually gets used.
body: Iâ€™m interested in the full development lifecycle, from idea and modeling to implementation and launch. I like understanding both the technical and practical sides of a system.

Alongside my studies I run a sole proprietorship in web development, delivering complete web solutions from needs analysis and design to development, publishing, and maintenance. That gives hands-on experience with structured work, delivery responsibility, and collaboration with users and clients.
I work with both backend and frontend, including programming, user interfaces, and data visualization, and I see frontend as an important part of making good systems whole.
My goal is to pair solid academic growth with projects that have real value, and to keep developing through collaboration with others.
